Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory101.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vera', 3: 'It finally quiets down...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'What about the other locations?', 3: '6'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "The other teams are on it. Shouldn't be much trouble.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The awakened machine stands there without a word, scanning the floor back and forth.'}
{3: 'Paints, spray cans, canvases yet to be painted...'}
{3: 'All kinds of things are scattered on the floor, but "broken limbs" is not one of them, fortunately. This "war" seems to be coming to an end.'}
{3: 'Perhaps he was drawing lines and putting down colors at this very place.'}
{3: 'With his hands on the hips, he would repeat what he told you, proudly describing his art.'}
{3: 'Now, all is ruined...'}
{3: 'You try to come up with something to say when he suddenly crouches down.'}
{3: 'He picks up something from the piles of bottles and cans and holds it before his visual sensor to confirm it.'}
{2: 'Awakened Machine', 3: "Found it! This is it! I'm glad it didn't spill!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The awakened machine cheers gleefully, holding a can of paint up high and excitedly rushing back to his easel.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'He opens the can expertly and pours the paint into the container before flicking his arm, seemingly prepared to continue his work.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Awakened Machine', 3: "Hold on. I'm almost done.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Awakened Machine', 3: 'The awakened machine Mark the Great is about to finish an artwork equally as great.', 4: '1'}
{2: "I suppose it's because there weren't any actual sacrifices.", 3: '30'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vera', 3: "I bet they'd still be doing the same thing even if something were utterly destroyed.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "Don't look at me like that. There's nothing surprising about it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "There are no unnecessary sentiments. There's only the objective and the relentless drive to fulfill it...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "Aren't Constructs like them role models in the Task Force?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Anyway. This charade is finally over.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "I'm sure you'll take care of the reports by yourself, right?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The torn curtains are flapping in the wind. Vera stretches, her shadow lengthened indefinitely by the setting sun.'}
{3: 'Before you know it, Constellia welcomes another night.'}
{2: "I can't help but feel like it's not over.", 3: '41'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Should I gather them in one place and do this again?', 4: '1'}
{2: "That's not necessary...", 3: '44'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "If something happens again, we'll handle it the way we did.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "I don't have the time to stay here and play Whac-A-Mole with these insurgences.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'You have other missions?', 3: '47'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Oh? Does the Gray Raven Commandant have that much free time? I suppose I have another suggestion for the General, then.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The deployment in Constellia is still cautiously proceeding, while a second scouting operation is going to take place in areas affected by the Hetero Tower.'}
{3: 'You are also curious why you would get assigned a peacekeeping mission at a time like this...'}
{2: 'I guess the dialogue with them will have to continue in the future.', 3: '52'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "Whatever. Just don't beg me to save you when it all goes south.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Awakened Machine', 3: 'Done!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'You are surprised by the sudden shout. Turning around, you see the awakened machine waving at you, gesturing you toward there.'}
{3: 'He seems to have finished drying the canvas with his equipment, and he is taking the painting down from the easel.'}
{3: 'Vera and you head toward him together, checking out what he has painted.'}
{2: 'Awakened Machine', 3: 'The awakened machine Mark the Great has finished this remarkable painting that was inspired by the two of you.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Awakened Machine', 3: 'I shall name it "The Advancing Valkyria".', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Awakened Machine', 3: "Given the limitations of a human body, I've placed the human here...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vera', 3: "See? This is why I said a dialogue or an understanding isn't necessary.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Vera slaps the edges of the canvas, interrupting the mechanoid's explanation."}
{3: 'You cannot blame Vera for reacting this way. It is a peculiar piece of art...'}
{3: 'A crimson figure is causing carnage in the center of the canvas menacingly.'}
{3: 'Multiple arms extend from her back as if two arms are not enough, all gripping a long sword and swinging viciously amidst splashing red paint.'}
{3: 'Her toothy maw and twisted expression make her face almost indistinguishable, but the headband-like Inver-Device above her head is purposefully depicted in an obvious manner.'}
{2: 'I can sort of see the resemblance.', 3: '71'}
{3: '"Swish!" Vera takes the canvas from the mechanoid.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Awakened Machine', 3: 'Be careful! You have received an art piece from Mark the Great. You must take good care of it.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Vera does not say anything. She turns around, slowly walking toward the burning brazier in the corner.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The awakened machine seems to realize what she is trying to do, and he immediately rushes forward to stop her.'}
{3: 'But Vera easily pushes him away with a light jab from her sheath, keeping the mechanoid from approaching her.'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "It's mine, isn't it? I can do whatever I want with it, then.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "I don't think I like it that much. I think it looks better in here.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'With that, Vera moves her hand with the canvas above the brazier and releases her index finger...'}
{2: 'Awakened Machine', 3: "Alright! Alright! Mark the Great hears you! I'll make the corrections right away.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Vera does not appear to be stopping, however. She releases another finger...'}
{2: 'Awakened Machine', 3: 'Just let Mark the Great know what else he can do for you! Speak your terms! The painting is innocent!', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Are you trying to negotiate with me about my things?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Sure. If you think you can keep up your end of the deal.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vera throws the canvas back at the awakened machine, who immediately reaches out to catch it.'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Tell your friends to stop playing silly revolutionaries in this city.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Awakened Machine', 3: "It's not silly to fight for art!", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Vera shows a rare look of resignation before continuing to speak.'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Is that so? Well, go on, then.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Go on and party all you want. For all you care, this city that humans and machines built together can burn and rot.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "And next time, it won't be the Gray Raven Commandant who's sent here.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The awakened machine considers what Vera says and does not refute it.'}
{3: 'Vera pushes open the door and leaves, having said her piece.'}
{1: 'RImgBg1DisableSlow'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory670.jpg'}
{1: '1', 3: 'But she immediately runs into a white-haired girl who has been standing outside.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{3: 'Without hesitation, Vera instinctively draws her blade.'}
{3: "But the girl does not react despite having Vera's blade pointed right at her."}
{3: 'Upon confirming that the girl with white hair is just a regular mechanoid, Vera walks past her expressionlessly, not intending to linger any further.'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Paranoia is a beastâ€”especially when it comes at you unnoticed.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Are you talking about the humans stationed in Constellia?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Hmph. Not entirely.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory670.jpg'}
{3: 'You only realize that it is already nighttime outside when you chase after Vera.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Vera is holding her private terminal and inspecting a file on it.'}
{2: 'That painting...', 3: '127'}
{2: "It's not that bad, to be honest.", 3: '128'}
{2: 'I can feel how fierce you were in the fight.', 3: '129', 4: 'You look like a sword that wins every fight.', 5: '129'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'The "fight"? I just cut some tubes and nozzles with my blade.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "But this isn't a bad idea.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Vera', 3: 'I should ask the mechanoid to do an oil painting of how you and the Nozzles were "playing" with paints back then. It needs to be large enough to be hung in the Cerberus lounge.', 4: '1'}
{3: '"Playing"... Even though you just disarmed some mechanoids with your restraint launcher, it was still an exhausting struggle.'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Regardless, my mission here is over.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "I even solved some of your problems preemptively right there at the end, didn't I? Aren't you going to thank me or something?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Was that really the only way?', 3: '138'}
{3: 'Vera stops smiling and turns off her terminal, pondering briefly.'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "Do you think they'd still pull the triggers if that wasn't spray paint in their hands, Commandant?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'I think they would.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vera offers her answer before you can say anything.'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "The only reason they didn't mangle parts from each other's bodies was that they were still wrestling with the morality of art.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'If any one of them loses control and breaks the rules, gaining an unmatched advantage... everything will come crumbling down.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "That mechanoid... was called Cervantes, wasn't he? He turned this city into a utopia... for the mechanoids, at least.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Unfortunately, this fairy tale is over.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Cervantes has left, and Constellia has been exposed. This quiet corner is starting to face the disquieting waves of the outside world.'}
{3: 'That is why this city can no longer afford to "cause a ruckus" anytime it wants.'}
{2: "Maybe they won't get there, right?", 3: '150'}
{2: 'Maybe there will be an awakened machine who stands up to them...', 3: '151'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "That's not something I have to consider. I'm only here to quash the riots as quickly as possible.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "And you're still here, aren't you? You'll be here to pick up the slack.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: "Unless you want to switch roles? I don't mind staying here and having some quality time with those mechanoids.", 4: '1'}
{2: "I can't really jump around with a sword...", 3: '159'}
{3: 'The blades of the windmill in the center of the city steadily spin.'}
{3: 'A breeze blows by, and you vaguely hear the mechanoid behind you screaming.'}
{3: '"Ah! My painting! My painting!"'}
{3: 'Forget it. Better plan for the future than wrestle with the past.'}
{3: 'Although you disagree with Vera, what she says is still worth considering in the case of an emergency.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'As for Vera, she is currently staring into the distance, her right hand gently pressing down her fluttering red hair.'}
{3: 'Following her gaze, you can see the lights on the windmill illuminating one by one.'}
{3: 'Compared to the limited space on Babylonia, this city clearly feels more like the Golden Age.'}
{3: 'Lit by the lights, the buildings soften the somber night sky.'}
{2: 'Want to head that way?', 3: '171'}
{3: 'Members from different forces that have arrived in this city have begun to reactivate the buildings in Constellia with the help of mechanoids who were not involved in the "war."'}
{3: 'She seems to be doing some math in her head. You remember her telling you her next mission starts tomorrow.'}
{2: 'Should I have phrased it differently?', 3: '175'}
{2: "I'm heading that way to investigate...", 3: '176'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Oh? Is that so?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: 'Godspeed, then, Commandant.', 4: '1'}
{2: "I believe you're still on a mission with me before tomorrow...", 3: '180', 4: 'I think you are obligated to escort me...', 5: '180'}
{2: 'Vera', 3: '...Are you a baby, Commandant?', 4: '1'}
{2: "It's better than hanging around here doing nothing...", 3: '182'}
{2: 'Unless you have something else to do?', 3: '183'}
{3: 'Eventually, Vera puts away her terminal and throws you a dirty look, seemingly asking you to lead the way.'}
{3: 'After all, you were here over a month ago as part of the Support Force. You do know more about the layout of the city.'}
{2: '(Where should we start? The Windmill Fair is not a bad idea...)', 3: '187'}
{3: 'You try to recall the places you have been and the sights you want to show Vera, sorting every one of them in a list.'}
{3: 'The sun has set, replaced by the moon shining over the hills.'}
{3: 'Lost in thought, you walk with Vera, heading toward that glowing place in the distance...'}
